msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Leviticus 19
ab.l:
And the Lord spoke to Moses,
saying,

‘Speak to all the congregation
of the children of Israel, and say to them, “You shall be holy: because
I, the Lord your God, am holy.

You shall |each| man fear his mother and
his father, and you shall keep my Sabbaths to keep them
with holiness. I am the Lord your God.

Do not turn
to vanities and you shall not make to yourselves molten gods. I am
the Lord your God.

And if you do a sacrifice of peace offerings
before the Lord, you shall offer it so that it will be accepted for you.

It shall be eaten the same day you offer it and at daybreak,
and what is left until the third day shall be burned in fire.

And if it is eaten on the third day, it is a defilement.
It shall not be accepted.

And everyone who eats
it shall bear his punishment, because he has defiled the Holy of the Lord,
and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

And
when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not finish harvesting the edge of your field,
and you shall not gather the gathering of your harvest.

And
you shall not gather all fruits of your vineyard and you shall not gather the dispersed grapes.
You shall leave them for the poor and the stranger. I am the Lord your God.
You shall not steal, and you shall not delude, and you shall not lie one to another.

And you shall not swear by my name falsely, so that you would not defile
the name of your God. I am the Lord.

You shall not oppress
your fellow, and you shall not rob. A hired worker’s wages shall not stay with you until the morning.

You shall not curse the deaf, and you shall not put an obstacle before the blind.
And you shall fear your God. I am the Lord.

You shall do no injustice in judgement.
You shall not favour the poor, and you shall not favour the rich.
You shall judge your fellow with justice.

You shall not walk as a slanderer
among your people. You shall not stand by at your fellow’s blood. I am the Lord.

You shall not be an enemy to your brother in your heart.
You shall surely rebuke your fellow, so you shall not bear sin because of him.

You shall not take revenge, and you shall not hate the people of your people.
And you shall love doing to your fellow that which you |would| love |to be done| to you. I am
the Lord.

You shall keep my statutes. Your livestock:
you shall not mate two kinds. Your field: you shall not sow two kinds. And
a garment of two kinds, shaatnez: it shall not go on you.

And if a man lies with a woman — an intercourse of seed — and she is
a maidservant designated to a man and she has not been redeemed at all, or freedom
has not been given to her: there shall be an investigation. They shall not be killed as
she was not free yet.

And he shall bring his guilt
offering to the Lord, to the door of the tent of meeting: a ram
for a guilt offering.

And the priest shall ask for atonement for him
with the ram of the guilt offering before
the Lord for his sin which he has sinned, and it will be forgiven for him from his sin
that he sinned.

And when you come to the land and
plant all manner of fruit trees, you shall separate the foreskin
of the fruit. It shall be uncircumcised for three years for you. It shall not be eaten.

But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be
holy, praises for the Lord.

And in the fifth
year shall you eat of its fruit, to increase its yield for you.
I am the Lord your God.

You shall not eat with the blood, you shall not |practice| divination,
and you shall not tell fortune.

You shall not shave around your head’s edge,
and you shall not destroy the edges of your beard.

And you shall not draw a line
in your flesh for a |dead| soul and you shall not draw marks
on you. I am the Lord.

Do not defile your daughter
to make her a prostitute, so that the people of the land will not fall into prostitution and the land will not become full of
abominable things.

You shall keep my Sabbaths to reverence
them, and fear my sanctuary. I am the Lord.

Do not turn to wizards and do not seek the soothsayers,
to become unclean by them. I am the Lord your God.

You shall get up before an aged person, and you shall honour the face of the old man, and
you shall fear your God. I am the Lord.

And if
a stranger resides with you in your land, you shall not torment him.

The stranger that resides among you shall be to you as one of your own land
and you shall love doing to him what you |would| love |to be done| to you, for you were strangers
in the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.

You shall not do an injustice in things you do: in grain measures,
in silver measures, and in wet measures.

There shall be just stones with just scales for measuring silver, and
there shall be a just ephah for measuring grain, and you shall have a just hin
for measuring drinks. I am the Lord your God, who brought you out
from the land of Egypt.

And you shall keep all my statutes
and all my judgments, and do them. I am the Lord.”’
